==Events==
*[[1179]] &ndash; The [[Norway|Norwegian]] Battle of Kalvskinnet outside [[Nidaros]]. [[Earl]] [[Erling Skakke]] is killed, and the battle changes the tide of the [[Civil war era in Norway|civil wars]].
*[[1269]] &ndash; King [[Louis IX of France]] orders all [[Jew]]s found in public without an identifying [[yellow badge]] to be fined ten [[French livre|livre]]s of [[silver]].
*[[1306]] &ndash; The [[Earl of Pembroke]]'s army defeats [[Robert the Bruce|Bruce's]] [[Scotland|Scottish]] army at the [[Battle of Methven]].
*[[1586]] &ndash; English colonists leave [[Roanoke Island]], after failing to establish [[Roanoke Colony|England's first permanent settlement]] in [[North America]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; [[Battle of Seven Oaks (1816)|Battle of Seven Oaks]] between [[North West Company]] and [[Hudson's Bay Company]], near [[Winnipeg]], [[Manitoba]], [[Canada]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; Decisive defeat of the [[Philikí Etaireía]] by the Ottomans at [[Drăgăşani]] (in [[Wallachia]]).
*  1821   &ndash; Coronation of [[George IV of the United Kingdom]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; The first officially recorded, organized [[History of baseball in the United States|baseball]] game is played under [[Alexander Cartwright]]'s rules on [[Hoboken, New Jersey]]'s Elysian Fields with the New York Base Ball Club defeating the Knickerbockers 23-1. Cartwright umpired.
*[[1850]] &ndash; [[Princess Louise of the Netherlands]] marries [[Charles XV of Sweden|Crown Prince Karl]] of [[Sweden-Norway]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] prohibits [[slavery]] in [[United States]] territories, nullifying [[Dred Scott v. Sandford]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; Over two years after the [[Emancipation Proclamation]], slaves in [[Galveston, Texas]], United States, are finally informed of their freedom. The anniversary is still officially celebrated in [[Texas]] and 41 other contiguous states as [[Juneteenth]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Maximilian I of Mexico|Maximilian I]] of the [[Second Mexican Empire]] is [[capital punishment|executed]] by a [[Execution by firing squad|firing squad]] in [[Querétaro, Querétaro]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; The [[Herzegovina Uprising (1875-1878)|Herzegovinian rebellion]] against the [[Ottoman Empire]] begins.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The first [[Father's Day]] is celebrated in [[Spokane, Washington]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; the Norwegian football club [[Molde FK]] was founded.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Natives' Land Act]] in [[South Africa]] implemented.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Communications Act of 1934]] establishes the United States' [[Federal Communications Commission]] (FCC).
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: First day of the [[Battle of the Philippine Sea]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Julius and Ethel Rosenberg]] are executed at [[Sing Sing]], in [[New York]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Kuwait]] declares independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Civil Rights Act of 1964]] is approved after surviving an 83-day [[filibuster]] in the United States Senate.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Nguyen Cao Ky]] becomes Prime Minister of [[South Vietnam]] at the head of a military junta; General [[Nguyen Van Thieu]] becomes the figurehead chief of state.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Shiv Sena]] a political party in India is founded in Mumbai.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Patent Cooperation Treaty]] is signed.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Garfield]], holder of the [[Guinness World Record]] for the world's most widely syndicated [[comic strip]], makes its debut.
*[[1982]] &ndash; In one of the first militant attacks by [[Hezbollah]], [[David S. Dodge]], president of the [[American University in Beirut]], is kidnapped.
*  1982   &ndash; The body of "God's Banker," [[Roberto Calvi]], is found hanging beneath [[Blackfriars Bridge]] in [[London]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; Members of the [[Revolutionary Party of Central American Workers]], dressed as [[El Salvador|Salvadoran]] soldiers, [[1985 Zona Rosa attacks|attack the Zona Rosa]] area of [[San Salvador]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; The current international law defending indigenous peoples, [[Indigenous and Tribal Peoples Convention, 1989]], is ratified for the first time by [[Norway]].
*  1990   &ndash; The [[Communist Party of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic]] is founded in [[Moscow]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Soviet occupation of Hungary]] ends.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Shishou incident|Mass riots]] involving over 10,000 people and 10,000 police officers break out in [[Shishou]], [[China]], over the dubious circumstances surrounding the death of a local chef.
*  2009   &ndash; [[War in North-West Pakistan]]: The [[Pakistani Armed Forces]] open [[Operation Rah-e-Nijat]] against the [[Taliban]] and other [[Islamist]] rebels in the [[South Waziristan]] area of the [[Federally Administered Tribal Areas]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Wikileaks]] founder [[Julian Assange]] requested asylum in London's Ecuatorian Embassy for fear of [[extradition]] to the US after publication of previously [[classified information|classified documents]] including footage of [[July 12, 2007 Baghdad airstrike|civilian killings by the US army]]. 
*[[2014]] &ndash; [[Felipe VI of Spain|Felipe VI]], Prince of Asturias, rises to the [[Monarchy of Spain|Spanish throne]] following the abdication of his father, [[Juan Carlos I of Spain|Juan Carlos I]].
